This property verifies that the sign signal correctly reflects the XOR of the most significant bits of opa and opb after one clock cycle when the circuit is enabled and not in reset.

The property triggers on every positive edge of the clk when rst is 0 and enable is 1. When this condition occurs, the property expects that on the next clock cycle (after one clock tick), the sign signal must equal the XOR of the most significant bits (bit 63) of opa and opb from the previous clock cycle.

The verification is disabled when rst is 1, meaning the property does not check the behavior during active reset conditions.
